info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 4:41PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lackawanna, southwestern Wayne, east central Luzerne and west central Pike Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 441 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Moscow, or 9 miles southeast of Scranton, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scranton, Dupont, Moscow, Sterling, Elmhurst, Lehigh, Bear Creek Village, Greentown, Gouldsboro and Ledgerdale. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 84 between 8 and 20. Interstate 380 between 20 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
